trans-unit.source: Manage alerts | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage alerts | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the Alerts workspace in Intune to assess the overall health of devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use the Alerts workspace in Intune to assess the overall health of devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Manage alerts in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage alerts in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the **Alerts** workspace in the Intune admin console to assess the overall health of devices in your organization and to identify problems.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Alerts** workspace in the Intune admin console to assess the overall health of devices in your organization and to identify problems.

trans-unit.source: View active alerts
trans-unit.target: View active alerts

trans-unit.source: See general information and summary data about active alerts.
trans-unit.target: See general information and summary data about active alerts.

trans-unit.source: To view active alerts
trans-unit.target: To view active alerts

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, follow one of these series of steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, follow one of these series of steps:

trans-unit.source: **To display general information about alerts**, including the top three alerts and the total number of active alerts, choose **System Overview**.
trans-unit.target: **To display general information about alerts**, including the top three alerts and the total number of active alerts, choose **System Overview**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the links in these alerts to see more detailed information.
trans-unit.target: Choose the links in these alerts to see more detailed information.

trans-unit.source: **To display summary data for alerts**, choose **Alerts** > **Overview**.
trans-unit.target: **To display summary data for alerts**, choose **Alerts** > **Overview**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Alerts Overview** page, you can see a summary of alerts in the **Alert Type Summary** area.
trans-unit.target: On the **Alerts Overview** page, you can see a summary of alerts in the **Alert Type Summary** area.

trans-unit.source: Critical alerts are listed first.
trans-unit.target: Critical alerts are listed first.

trans-unit.source: Choose the links in these alerts to see more detailed information.
trans-unit.target: Choose the links in these alerts to see more detailed information.

trans-unit.source: **To display all active alerts**, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts**.
trans-unit.target: **To display all active alerts**, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Alerts** page, you can see a list of all active alerts.
trans-unit.target: On the **Alerts** page, you can see a list of all active alerts.

trans-unit.source: The page has these columns:
trans-unit.target: The page has these columns:

trans-unit.source: **Name**.
trans-unit.target: **Name**.

trans-unit.source: This is the name of the alert type that generated the alert.
trans-unit.target: This is the name of the alert type that generated the alert.

trans-unit.source: **Source**.
trans-unit.target: **Source**.

trans-unit.source: This column has a link to the source of the alert.
trans-unit.target: This column has a link to the source of the alert.

trans-unit.source: If the display threshold of the alert type is set to **Display All**, this link shows a single device.
trans-unit.target: If the display threshold of the alert type is set to **Display All**, this link shows a single device.

trans-unit.source: If the display threshold of the alert type is set to a value, the link shows a list of each device that's affected by this alert.
trans-unit.target: If the display threshold of the alert type is set to a value, the link shows a list of each device that's affected by this alert.

trans-unit.source: **Last Updated**.
trans-unit.target: **Last Updated**.

trans-unit.source: This indicates the time when the alert was last modified.
trans-unit.target: This indicates the time when the alert was last modified.

trans-unit.source: If an alert is closed, the time when the alert was closed is shown.
trans-unit.target: If an alert is closed, the time when the alert was closed is shown.

trans-unit.source: **Severity**.
trans-unit.target: **Severity**.

trans-unit.source: This column indicates the severity of the alert.
trans-unit.target: This column indicates the severity of the alert.

trans-unit.source: View notice board alerts
trans-unit.target: View notice board alerts

trans-unit.source: Notice board alerts provide important service announcements.
trans-unit.target: Notice board alerts provide important service announcements.

trans-unit.source: They might provide information about an upcoming service upgrade or maintenance schedule or the status of an outage.
trans-unit.target: They might provide information about an upcoming service upgrade or maintenance schedule or the status of an outage.

trans-unit.source: To view and manage notice board alerts
trans-unit.target: To view and manage notice board alerts

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, choose **System Overview**.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, choose **System Overview**.

trans-unit.source: If there are important service announcements, they are shown in the **Notice Board** area.
trans-unit.target: If there are important service announcements, they are shown in the **Notice Board** area.

trans-unit.source: If you want to export a notice board alert to a comma-separated value (CSV) or HTML file, in the Intune admin console, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts** > **Notices**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to export a notice board alert to a comma-separated value (CSV) or HTML file, in the Intune admin console, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts** > **Notices**.

trans-unit.source: Select a notice, choose the **Export List** icon, and then follow the instructions shown.
trans-unit.target: Select a notice, choose the **Export List** icon, and then follow the instructions shown.

trans-unit.source: Review Intune system status
trans-unit.target: Review Intune system status

trans-unit.source: In the **System Overview** workspace, you can view **System Status** summaries for the Endpoint Protection, Updates, Agent Health, Policy, and Software categories to help you identify and prioritize issues that need immediate attention.
trans-unit.target: In the **System Overview** workspace, you can view **System Status** summaries for the Endpoint Protection, Updates, Agent Health, Policy, and Software categories to help you identify and prioritize issues that need immediate attention.

trans-unit.source: Error messages that are generated when the system is interrupted link to the **Service Status** summary.
trans-unit.target: Error messages that are generated when the system is interrupted link to the **Service Status** summary.

trans-unit.source: The **Service Status** summary shows details about the problem at each location and the last time the status summary was updated.
trans-unit.target: The **Service Status** summary shows details about the problem at each location and the last time the status summary was updated.

trans-unit.source: To view the status of your subscription
trans-unit.target: To view the status of your subscription

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, choose **System Overview**.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, choose **System Overview**.

trans-unit.source: Explore the **System Status** area for the status of the different Microsoft Intune components.
trans-unit.target: Explore the **System Status** area for the status of the different Microsoft Intune components.

trans-unit.source: Many of the items are linked so that you can see more information.
trans-unit.target: Many of the items are linked so that you can see more information.

trans-unit.source: For example, under **Endpoint Protection**, if you choose the number of instances, you can see the **Endpoint Protection** workspace, with a list of malware that was detected.
trans-unit.target: For example, under **Endpoint Protection**, if you choose the number of instances, you can see the **Endpoint Protection** workspace, with a list of malware that was detected.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the number of devices, you can see the **Groups** workspace, with a list of devices on which malware was found.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the number of devices, you can see the **Groups** workspace, with a list of devices on which malware was found.

trans-unit.source: Close and reactivate alerts
trans-unit.target: Close and reactivate alerts

trans-unit.source: Intune alerts stay active until one of these events occurs:
trans-unit.target: Intune alerts stay active until one of these events occurs:

trans-unit.source: The issue that caused the alert to be generated is fixed.
trans-unit.target: The issue that caused the alert to be generated is fixed.

trans-unit.source: The alert is manually closed.
trans-unit.target: The alert is manually closed.

trans-unit.source: Five days pass after the alert was generated.
trans-unit.target: Five days pass after the alert was generated.

trans-unit.source: After 45 days, the alert expires and is automatically closed.
trans-unit.target: After 45 days, the alert expires and is automatically closed.

trans-unit.source: Alerts that are marked as closed are permanently deleted after 90 days.
trans-unit.target: Alerts that are marked as closed are permanently deleted after 90 days.

trans-unit.source: To manually close an alert
trans-unit.target: To manually close an alert

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, follow one of these series of steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, follow one of these series of steps:

trans-unit.source: **To close an alert from the Alerts list**, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts**.
trans-unit.target: **To close an alert from the Alerts list**, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts**.

trans-unit.source: Select an alert, and then choose **Close Alert**.
trans-unit.target: Select an alert, and then choose **Close Alert**.

trans-unit.source: **To close an alert for a specific device**, choose **Groups** > **All Devices**.
trans-unit.target: **To close an alert for a specific device**, choose **Groups** > **All Devices**.

trans-unit.source: Select a device, and then choose **View Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Select a device, and then choose **View Properties**.

trans-unit.source: Then, on the **Alerts** tab, select an alert, and then choose **Close Alert**.
trans-unit.target: Then, on the **Alerts** tab, select an alert, and then choose **Close Alert**.

trans-unit.source: **To close a notice board alert**, choose **System Overview**.
trans-unit.target: **To close a notice board alert**, choose **System Overview**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **X** next to the notice board alert.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **X** next to the notice board alert.

trans-unit.source: To view and reactivate closed alerts
trans-unit.target: To view and reactivate closed alerts

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts**.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, choose **Alerts** > **All Alerts**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Filters** list, choose **Closed**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Filters** list, choose **Closed**.

trans-unit.source: You can see the names and additional information about the alerts in the management list pane.
trans-unit.target: You can see the names and additional information about the alerts in the management list pane.

trans-unit.source: See details about the selected alert in the preview pane.
trans-unit.target: See details about the selected alert in the preview pane.

trans-unit.source: To reactivate the selected alert, choose **Reactivate Alert**.
trans-unit.target: To reactivate the selected alert, choose **Reactivate Alert**.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Get notified by Microsoft Intune alerts
trans-unit.target: Get notified by Microsoft Intune alerts
